title.narrative: Strengthening justice and accountability for international crimes in Nigeria

description.narrative: Activities: training workshops (in-person, and online), in-house mentoring sessions, high-level meetings and media engagements.

Outcome 1: Well-trained Nigerian prosecutors who have the knowledge and tools to prosecute international crimes and terrorism under Nigerian law. Outcome 2: Well-trained military investigators and prosecutors of the “Serious Crimes Response Team” (SCRT) equipped with the knowledge and skills to address, under Nigerian law, allegations of war crimes and crimes against humanity committed by the Armed Forces. Outcome 3: Improved and accurate reporting on the investigation and prosecution of international crimes
Prosecutors from the Complex Casework Group within the Directorate of Public Prosecutions, investigators and prosecutors from the Nigerian military and media representatives.

The overall goal of the project is to ensure that the Nigerian justice system is better equipped to investigate and prosecute international crimes genuinely and effectively in line with Nigeria’s obligations under the Rome Statute.
A sum of Euro 66,033 was not spent in the first year due to the covid pandemic. This was spent in the second year of the project.
Project funds from year 2 as well as the left over funds of Euro 66,033 from the first year were spent in the 2nd year of the project.

The final sum of Euro 80,150 is still pending. The final report for the project was submitted in accordance with the contract in January 2022. The final amount will be disbursed after determination of the definite grant by the grantor.
